title.rendered: 7 AI Apps makes your smartphones smarter

content.rendered:
Today in this blog, we are going to learn about 7 AI Apps makes your smartphones smarter. Do you remember in old times we use floppy, CD to store our memories and data. Now in today’s world it got replaced by one mobile device that is the best invention in mankind history “Smartphones”. So let’s move forward to learn about these app. I hope many of you are already aware about but do you know they work on AI based algorithms.

Allo

So in our list of 7 AI Apps makes your smartphones smarter we will start with Allo is an AI-centric messaging app developed by Google. It was launched on September 21, 2016, and is available for both Android and iOS. At first glance, you’ll feel that it is very similar to many other messaging apps out there. Be it sign up with the phone number, one-on-one or group chats, voice messages, themed stickers, or images with a doodle, it is pretty much what any messaging app offers.

Socratic

Every kid wishes that somebody could tell the answers to all the homework questions. There you go! Socratic is an app that says “Homework in a Snap.”

Socratic is a free app available on iOS for Apple devices. It is a tutor app that can give answers to math homework problems and also explain how to solve it just by taking a picture of the problem. Not only math, it currently provides help in 23 different subjects, including Chemistry, Anatomy and Physiology, Physics, English grammar, Calculus, History, and Psychology.

Microsoft Pix

Microsoft Pix is a smartphone app that helps click better photographs automatically without extra effort. This is among these 7 AI Apps makes your smartphones smarter list. Its tagline is “Point. Shoot. Perfect.” It is only available for devices running on iOS 9 or newer such as iPhone 5s and newer, iPad Air & Air 2, and iPad Mini 2, 3, 4. Some features includes smart settings, Live image, Face recognition.

Siri

Siri, the famous virtual assistant from Apple doesn’t need too much of an introduction, and it’s one of the most popular AI apps. This AI-powered virtual assistant is available on major Apple platforms, e.g., iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, and audios. Siri uses voice queries and a natural language user interface (UI) to function, and it can make calls, send text messages, answer questions, and offer recommendations.

Easily Do

EasilyDo is an app which helps you manage calendar, contacts, and to-do lists. The tagline is “Easily Do: Your Smart Assistant. Never Miss Anything.” It tries to do some jobs that a real-life assistant would do by offering an artificial intelligence-based organization.

Google Assistant

Launched in 2016, Google Assistant, i.e., the AI-enabled, voice-powered virtual assistant from Google has made significant strides. It’s considered as one of the more advanced virtual assistants.

ELSA

ELSA Speak is a popular AI-powered app to learn how to speak English. Users of this app can learn how to speak English and pronounce English words with the help of short dialogues. AI helps them with instant feedback, therefore, they can expect to make quick progress.

I you want to learn more about this 7 AI Apps makes your smartphones smarter and new technologies visit HawksCode and Easyshiksha and check out this video.
